title.narrative: Smart Grid Study, through CH2M HILL, Inc.

description.narrative: This project planning advisory services activity is to support the Ethiopian Electrical Utility's plan to integrate smart grid technologies into its electricity distribution system. The implementation of smart grid technologies would increase the reliability of Ethiopia's distribution network and provide opportunities for U.S. companies to participate in the sector.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Smart Grid Study, through CH2M HILL, Inc.

description.narrative: This project planning advisory services activity is to support the Ethiopian Electrical Utility's plan to integrate smart grid technologies into its electricity distribution system. The implementation of smart grid technologies would increase the reliability of Ethiopia's distribution network and provide opportunities for U.S. companies to participate in the sector. The technical assistance will be carried out under USTDA's Energy Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity Contract.

title.narrative: Airline Solutions Training Program, through Sabre Holdings Corporation

description.narrative: A USTDA grant is partially funding an Airline Solutions Training Program ("Technical Assistance") for Ethiopian Airlines Enterprise (Ethiopia) and its partner airlines, ASKY Airlines (Togo), Malawian Airlines Limited (Malawi), and RwandAir Limited (Rwanda) to address key constraints for Africa's aviation sector and to help improve the airlines' operational efficiency and profitability. The Technical Assistance supports the procurement and implementation of airline information technology solutions, consulting services and industry best practices. The Technical Assistance is being performed by U.S. travel technology company Sabre GLBL Inc. (Southlake, Texas).

title.narrative: Tulu Moye Geothermal Project, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to TM Geothermal Operations Private Limited Company partially funds a feasibility study to assess the viability of a 50-megawatt geothermal power plant in Ethiopia ("Project"). Successful implementation of the Project would provide clean, renewable power in Ethiopia and support the Government of Ethiopia's Second Growth and Transformation Plan.

Successful implementation of the Project would provide clean, renewable power in Ethiopia and support the Government of Ethiopia's Second Growth and Transformation Plan. title.narrative: Ethiopia: Smart Village Solution Pilot and Feasibility Study, through Villedge Solutions Inc.

description.narrative: This USTDA grant to the Amhara Development Association funds a pilot and feasibility study to assess the deployment of solar-powered telecommunications, electricity, lighting, and water infrastructure throughout villages within the Amhara Region of Ethiopia to support a Smart Village that will stimulate the regions sustainable long-term economic development. The U.S. firm, Villedge Solutions Inc., is completing the study on a sole-source basis.

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - Procurement Assistance Program for Ethiopia: Phase III Procurement Advisor, through Crown Agents Ltd.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for Ethiopia: Phases III, through Crown Agents Ltd.

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant provides funding for a Procurement Advisor to assist the Ethiopian Electric Power (EEP) for a period of 18 months. The grant represents Phase III of the Procurement Assistance Program for Ethiopia under the Global Procurement Initiative. The Advisor will provide strategic and technical procurement advice on energy sector procurements, with the goal of incorporating value-based methodologies into EEP's procurement process. A value-based procurement system will help EEP implement sustainable, high-quality energy projects and may increase opportunities for U.S. companies to bid on and potentially win energy tenders.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - Procurement Assistance Program for Ethiopia: Phase III Procurement Advisor, through Crown Agents Ltd.

title.narrative: Ethiopian Nationwide Broadcast Television Digitalization, through GatesAir, Inc.

description.narrative: A USTDA raining grant is supporting the U.S. company GatesAir, Inc.'s bid to provide equipment and services to the Ethiopian Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT) that are required for the second phase of Ethiopia's digital broadcast migration, which will upgrade the terrestrial television service in the country from analog to digital technology (Project). Implementation of the Project would help Ethiopia to meet requirements under the United Nations International Telecommunication Union (ITU) 2006 treaty agreement identifying June 17, 2015 as the deadline for member states to transition from analog to digital broadcasting.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

Implementation of the Project would help Ethiopia to meet requirements under the United Nations International Telecommunication Union (ITU) 2006 treaty agreement identifying June 17, 2015 as the deadline for member states to transition from analog to digital broadcasting.
